feed.title: Track Magictools Updates Weekly
feed.subtitle: :video_game: :pencil: A list of Game Development resources to make magic happen.

entry.title: Magictools Updates on Jun 26 - Jul 02, 2023
entry.content:
Graphics / Vector/Image Editor

  • üÜì Charas - Charas is a charset generator for RPG Maker.
  • üí∞ Pixelmator - Full-featured image editing app for the Mac
  • üí∞ Pixelator - Turn any image into fancy pixel-art
  • üéâ SVGcode - SVGcode is a Progressive Web App that lets you convert raster images like JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP, AVIF, etc. to vector graphics in SVG format.
  • üéâ VTracer - Raster to Vector Graphics Converter built on top of visioncortex

Graphics / Modeling

  • üí∞ 3ds Max
  • üí∏ Besel - Make a 3d real-time collaboration design and prototype in your VR headset or mobile AR.
  • üÜì Clara.io
  • üí∏ Daz 3D - A 3D software allows you to easily create custom scenes and characters in seconds.
  • üÜì sculptris - A version by Pixologic and the original 1.01
  • üÜì Womp - A 3D intuitive and easy to use for create right in your browser
entry.summary: 11 awesome projects updated on Jun 26 - Jul 02, 2023

entry.content:
Graphics / Tile/Level Editors

  • üéâ Material Maker (‚≠ê4.2k) - procedural texture creator made in Godot

Graphics / Animation

  • üí∏ Cascadeur - Powerful physics-based 3D character animation
  • üí∞ Fusion Character Animator - small tool for Clickteam Fusion 2.5 to facilitate the animation of 2D character sprites for developers.
  • üÜì GraphicsDale - Powerful tool for spriting and pixel art.
  • üéâ Pixel Composer (‚≠ê920) - Powerful node-based VFX editor for pixel art
  • üí∞ Spine - Spine is dedicated to 2D animation, providing an efficient workflow both for creating amazing animation and for integrating it into your games.
  • üí∞ Spriter Pro - Modern tool for sprite animation.

Game Jams / Voxel Editors

entry.title: Magictools Updates on Jan 17 - Jan 23, 2022
entry.content:
Graphics / Spritesheet Tools

  • üéâ EzSpriteSheet (‚≠ê48) - Creates sprite sheets from animated GIFs and more

Engines and Frameworks / Voxel Editors

  • üÜì Cocos Creator - Cocos Creator, a free cross-platform game development editor supporting Cocos2d-js, helps developers build 2D and 3D game scenes, edit game UI and other game resources quickly and efficiency.
  • üí∏ CopperCube - CopperCube is an all-in-one 3D game engine.Very easy to use.
  • üéâ Defold - Free 2D Game Engine for Cross-Platform Publishing
  • üÜì Lumberyard - Amazon Lumberyard is a free AAA game engine deeply integrated
  • üéâ nuklear (‚≠ê10k) - A single-header ANSI C immediate mode cross-platform GUI library.
  • üéâ OpenXRay (‚≠ê3.3k) - a community-modified X-Ray engine used in S.T.A.L.K.E.R. game series.
  • üéâ Pixel Vision 8 (‚≠ê1.7k) - Pixel Vision 8's core philosophy is to teach retro game development with streamlined workflows. PV8 is also a platform that standardizes 8-bit fantasy console limitations built on top of the open-source C# game engine based on MonoGame.
entry.summary: 8 awesome projects updated on Jan 17 - Jan 23, 2022

entry.title: Magictools Updates on Jun 07 - Jun 13, 2021
entry.content:
Graphics / Assets/Placeholders

  • üÜì 2D Cartoon Mobile Game UI Pack - cartoon user interface asset pack. It comes as a layered psd file.
  • üÜì 420 Pixel Art Icons for RPGs - Set of 420 RPG icons, free for commercial use.
  • üÜì Blender 3D models - 3D models, particle systems/effects
  • üí∏ CGTextures - A large collection of textures.
  • üí∏ GameDev Market - a community-driven marketplace that connects indie game developers with talented asset creators.
  • üÜì Games-Icons Set - free icons for your games.
  • üÜì Iconmonstr - Another free icons resource for your games.
  • üí∏ Kenney Assets - Royalty free assets
  • üÜì Liberated Pixel Cup assets - Free graphic assets of the Liberated Pixel Cup (LPC) held by the OpenGameArt forums
  • üÜì Matcaps (‚≠ê2.9k) - A Huge library of matcap textures in PNG and ZMT, organized by color.
  • üÜì OpenGameArt - a media repository intended for use with free software game projects.
  • üí∞ Oryx Design Lab - Cheap high quality royalty free sprites
  • üí∏ PlainTextures - Free high resolution textures, brushes and photos
  • üÜì Reiner's Tilesets - A blog with free 2D and 3D graphics.
  • üÜì Sketchfab - Publish & embed interactive 3D models.
  • üÜì SpriteLib - a collection of static and animated graphic objects (also commonly known as sprites).
  • üÜì StickyPNG - Free transparent PNG images.
  • üÜì TextureHaven - Free textures with additional maps like displacement and bump maps. Also HDRIs.
  • üÜì TextureKing - Free material stock textures
  • üí∏ Vecteezy - Free Vector Art.

Graphics / Spritesheet Tools

  • üéâ Cheetah-Texture-Packer (‚≠ê243) - High efficient and fast 2D bin packing tool
  • üéâ Libgdx Texture Packer (‚≠ê24k) - Texture Packer built into Libgdx
  • üÜì Littera - Bitmap font generator
  • üÜì ShoeBox - Adobe Air based app with game and ui related tools.
  • üí∏ TexturePacker - Great spritesheet creation editor.
  • üéâ Tilesplit (‚≠ê3) - CLI text-based tilesheet splitter and namer. Turn a spritesheet into many separate files with names you pick, or not if you don't care. Support templates and textures that are not all the same size.

Graphics / Bitmap Compression

  • üéâ ImageAlpha ‚Äî Mac OS X GUI for pngquant and other tools
  • üÜì PNGGauntlet - Smash PNGs for faster sites
  • üÜì PNGoo - Windows GUI for batch conversion.
  • üéâ Pngyu - simple PNG image file compression tool.
  • üí∏ TinyPNG - Advanced lossy compression for PNG images that preserves full alpha transparency.

Graphics / Texture Tools

  • üí∞ FilterForge - A plugin for Adobe Photoshop that allows you to build your own filters.
  • üÜì Live Normal - An Android and iOS app for generating seamless materials on the go. You take a photo, and Live Normal creates a tile-able texture and generates texture maps ready for a PBR engine of your choice.
  • üí∞ PixPlant - PixPlant is a smart 3D texturing tool that creates high quality normal, displacement, specular maps and seamless textures from photos.

Graphics / Tile/Level Editors

  • üí∞ AutoTileGen - AutoTileGen is an automatic tileset generator for 2D game terrains.
  • üéâ LDtk - LDtk is an open-source 2D level editor for indie devs, with a strong focus on user-friendliness.
  • üéâ OGMO Editor- generic level editor.
  • üéâ Overlap2D (‚≠ê785) - a 2D level and UI editor with an engine agnostic philosophy.
  • üéâ Tiled - free, easy to use and flexible tile map editor.

Graphics / Animation

  • üéâ LWF - Lightweight SWF. LWF is an animation engine which can play animation data converted from FLASH contents in HTML5, Unity, Cocos2d-x, iOS UIKit, and more.
  • üí∞ Mixamo - tool for auto auto rigging and animation of 3D humanoid models,

Graphics / Vector/Image Editor

  • üí∞ Affinity Designer - Vector graphics editor with a bunch of features which also supports Adobe file formats
  • üí∞ Affinity Photo - Photo and raster graphics editor which works together with Adobe file formats and Affinity Designer
  • üí∏ Aseprite - animated sprite editor & pixel art tool.
  • üéâ Gimp - GNU Image Manipulation Program. It is a freely distributed piece of software for such tasks as photo retouching, image composition and image authoring.
  • üéâ Inkscape - An open-source vector graphics editor similar to Adobe Illustrator, Corel Draw, Freehand, or Xara X.
  • üéâ Krita - Krita is a professional FREE and open source painting program. It is made by artists that want to see affordable art tools for everyone.
  • üéâ LibreSprite - LibreSprite is an open source fork of Aseprite.
  • üÜì Multipaint - A cross-platform (Win, Linux, Mac) image editor/painter which covers the color limitations of 8-bit machines (like C64, ZX Spectrum etc.)
  • üí∏ Paint.NET - Paint.NET is free image and photo editing software for PCs that run Windows.
  • üí∞ Pickle - Another Pixel art Editor.
  • üéâ PiskelApp - Free Online Pixel Art and Animated Sprite Tool.
  • üí∞ Pixen (‚≠ê931) - Pixel Art Editor for OSX
  • üÜì project one - A picture converter and editor for the Commodore 64 covering different graphics mode of this computer. Windows only
  • üí∞ PyxelEdit - Pixel art editor designed to make it fun and easy to make tilesets, levels and animations.
  • üÜì REXPaint - a powerful and user-friendly ASCII art editor.
  • üéâ rx - a modern & minimalist pixel editor
  • üÜì Tilemancer - A quick procedural tile creator designed for pixel-art games.
  • üÜì Timanthes - A pixel art editor for the Commodore 64 computer running on Windows
  • üÜì Spritemate - Online Editor for Commodore 64 Sprites

Graphics / Modeling

  • üÜì MakeHuman
  • üí∞ Maya
  • üí∞ modo

Graphics / Terrain Generators

  • üÜì Canyon Terrain Editor - Create quality, realistic terrain quickly and intuitively
  • üéâ DEM Net Elevation API - Live 3D textured terrain generation from real data - export height/normal maps, glTF, OBJ, STL
  • üéâ Fracplanet - Fractal planet and terrain generator
  • üí∞ World Creator - Procedural terrain and landscape generation on the GPU in real time, simulation of erosion and sediment, beautiful editor. much more
  • üí∞ World Machine - Procedural terrain creation, simulations of nature, and interactive editing

Graphics / Voxel Editors

  • üéâ goxel (‚≠ê3k)
  • üÜì MagicaVoxel
  • üÜì Sproxel

Engines and Frameworks / Voxel Editors

  • üéâ Allegro - Allegro 4 & 5 are cross-platform, open source, game programming libraries, primarily for C and C++ developers.
  • üéâ amulet - A free Lua-based audio/visual toolkit suitable for small games and experimentation. It runs on Windows, Mac, Linux, HTML5 and iOS.
  • üéâ Astera (‚≠ê294) - 2D C99 Cross Platform Game Library / Framework
  • üéâ Azul3D - A 3D engine written in Go.
  • üéâ Babylon.js - Javascript 3D Library.
  • üéâ Bevy - A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust
  • üéâ bgfx (‚≠ê16k) - Cross-platform, graphics API agnostic, "Bring Your Own Engine/Framework" style rendering library.
  • üéâ bitsy - A little editor for little games or worlds. The goal is to make it easy to make games where you can walk around and talk to people and be somewhere.
  • üéâ Bladecoder (‚≠ê621) - Classic point and click adventure game engine and editor.
  • üí∏ Blend4Web - A Javascript framework for creating and displaying interactive 3D computer graphics in web browsers.
  • üéâ Blitz3D (‚≠ê265) 3D basic-like programming language for fast 3D desktop games.
  • üéâ Box2D - A 2D Physics Engine for Games.
  • üéâ Bullet - Real-time physics simulation.
  • üéâ Chipmunk C# (‚≠ê82) - C# implementation of the Chipmunk2D lib.
  • üéâ Chipmunk2D - A fast and lightweight 2D game physics library.
  • üéâ Cinder - Cinder is a community-developed, free and open source library for professional-quality creative coding in C++.
  • üéâ Cocos2D (‚≠ê636) - graphic library for games and multimedia, for python language
  • üéâ Cocos2d-x - a C++ OpenGL 2D and 3D game engine. Uses C++ but has JS and Lua bindings. Target all the major mobile platforms and operating systems. Additional tools CocoStudio and Cocos Code IDE.
  • üéâ Coquette - A micro framework for JavaScript games. Handles collision detection, the game update loop, canvas rendering, and keyboard and mouse input.
  • üéâ Dash (‚≠ê426) - A free and open 3D game engine written in D.
  • üéâ Dear Imgui (‚≠ê67k) - A bloat-free immediate mode GUI for C++ with minimal dependencies.
  • üéâ DEM Net Elevation API C# (‚≠ê325) - Terrain generation from real data with textures, normal maps, glTF, OBJ, STL support
  • üéâ Diligent Engine (‚≠ê3.9k) - A modern cross-platform low-level graphics library that supports Direct3D11, Direct3D12, OpenGL/GLES, and Vulkan.
  • üéâ E.B.U.R.P - The Eight-Bit Universal Role Playing Engine
  • üéâ ENGi (‚≠ê396) - A multi-platform 2D game library for Go.
  • üéâ engo - Engo is an open-source 2D game engine written in Go.
  • üéâ Ebiten - A dead simple 2D game library in Go.
  • üéâ ecs-lib (‚≠ê211) - ecs-lib is a tiny and easy to use ECS (Entity Component System) library for game programming. It's written in Typescript but you can use on node.js and web browser too.
  • üéâ Ejecta - A Fast, Open Source JavaScript, Canvas & Audio Implementation for iOS.
  • üéâ EnTT (‚≠ê11k) - Gaming meets modern C++, a fast and reliable entity-component system (ECS) and much more
  • üéâ FXGL (‚≠ê4.6k) - A JavaFX/Kotlin game engine for Win/Mac/Linux.
  • üéâ Farseer (‚≠ê705) - a collision detection system with realistic physics responses.
  • üéâ Flame (‚≠ê10k) - a minimalist game engine for Flutter
  • üéâ FlashPunk - free ActionScript 3 library designed for developing 2D Flash games.
  • üéâ gameplay - A free, open-source, cross-platform, 2D + 3D game framework written in C++. It is aimed towards indie game developers who are creating desktop and mobile games.
  • üí∏ GameSalad - Game Creation Engine for Mac and Windows.
  • üéâ GB Studio - A free and easy to use retro adventure game creator for your favourite handheld video game system.
  • üéâ GDevelop - An open-source, cross-platform 2D game engine designed for everyone - it's extensible, fast and easy to learn.
  • üéâ ggez - A Rust library to create Good Games Easily.
  • üéâ Gideros - A Cross-Platform framework to create Mobile Apps and games for iOS, Android using Lua programming language.
  • üéâ Glide Engine (‚≠ê499) - Engine for making 2d games on iOS, macOS and tvOS in Swift programming language, with practical examples and tutorials.
  • üéâ Godot - An advanced, feature-packed, multi-platform 2D and 3D open-source game engine.
  • üéâ Gorgon - A 2D rendering API for .NET, written in C#.
  • üéâ HaxeFlixel - Create cross-platform games easier and free.
  • üéâ Heaps - Cross platform graphics for high performance games.
  • üéâ Horde3D - small open source 3D rendering engine.
  • üéâ iio.js (‚≠ê455) - A javascript library that speeds the creation and deployment of HTML5 Canvas applications
  • üéâ ImpactJS - Impact is a JavaScript Game Engine that allows you to develop stunning HTML5 Games for desktop and mobile browsers.
  • üÜì Inform7 - A design system for interactive fiction based on natural language.
  • üéâ Ink - Scripting language for writing interactive narrative.
  • üéâ Irrlicht - open source high performance realtime 3D engine written in C++.
  • üéâ Jitter (‚≠ê45) - a fast and lightweight physics engine written in C#.
  • üéâ jMonkeyEngine 3 - a 3D open-source game engine for adventurous Java developers.
  • üéâ Juno (‚≠ê24) - Clean and lightweight 2D game framework written in TypeScript
  • üéâ Juno (‚≠ê168) - Framework for making 2D games with chunky pixels in Lua
  • üéâ Kivent - A 2D game framework for Kivy.
  • üéâ Kivy - Cross platform Python framework for creating apps and games for Linux, Windows, OS X, Android and iOS
  • üéâ KogGE - Modern Multiplatform Game Engine for Kotlin. Write games for the JVM, JavaScript, Android and iOS in no time using Kotlin.
  • üéâ LibGDX - Powerful (totally free) library for Java, code once and run the game on desktop, Android, Web, and iOS.
  • üéâ LimeJS - HTML5 game framework for building fast, native-experience games for all modern touchscreens and
  • üéâ LITIengine - 2D Java Game Engine. It provides all the infrastructure to create tile based 2D games with plain java
  • üéâ LumixEngine (‚≠ê3.6k) - 3D Game engine built on C++.
  • üéâ Lums (‚≠ê28) - A 2D / 3D framework written in C++11. Very efficient and modern. Still under heavy development.
  • üéâ L√ñVE - Lua 2D Game Engine.
  • üéâ MINX (‚≠ê14) - Open Source 2D game framework written in C++ (to the style of XNA)
  • üéâ Magnum - a lightweight and modular 2D/3D graphics/game engine written in C++11
  • üéâ Matter.js - a 2D physics engine for the web.
  • üéâ MelonJS - open source light-weight HTML5 game engine.
  • üéâ Monogame - Open Source implementation of the Microsoft XNA 4 Framework.
  • üéâ Nakama (‚≠ê11k) - Distributed server for social and realtime games and apps.
  • üéâ nCine - A cross-platform 2D game engine with an emphasis on performance, written in C++11 and optionally scriptable in Lua.
  • üÜì NodeBox - a family of Python tools to create generative design.
  • üéâ √ñbEngine (‚≠ê840) - 2D Game Engine with Lua Scripting made on top of SFML !
  • üéâ ODE - ODE is an open source, high performance library for simulating rigid body dynamics.
  • üéâ Ogre3D - is a scene-oriented, real-time, flexible 3D rendering engine (as opposed to a game engine) written in C++.
  • üéâ OpenFL - Open Source Haxe Engine for making multi-platform games.
  • üéâ openFrameworks - An open source and free C++ toolkit for creative coding.
  • üéâ OpenRA - OpenRA is a Libre/Free Real Time Strategy Game Engine.
  • üí∞ PICO-8 - A fantasy console for making, sharing and playing tiny games and other computer programs.
  • üéâ p2.js - JavaScript 2D physics library
  • üéâ Panda3D - a framework for 3D rendering and game development for Python and C++ programs.
  • üéâ Phaser - free and fast 2D game framework for making HTML5 games for desktop and mobile web browsers, supporting Canvas and WebGL rendering.
  • üéâ Piston - a modular open source game engine written in Rust.
  • üéâ PixiJS - is a newcomer HTML5 game renderer - first released in early 2013. A main appeal of the engine is its use of WebGL for faster performance. If WebGL isn't supported, the engine falls back to standard canvas.
  • üéâ Planck.js - 2D JavaScript physics engine for cross-platform HTML5 game development.
  • üí∏ PlayCanvas - A WebGL Game Engine.
  • üéâ Processing - Processing is a programming language, development environment for artists, designers, researchers.
  • üéâ PuzzleScript - open-source HTML5 puzzle game engine.
  • üí∞ RPGMaker - series of programs for the development of role-playing games.
  • üéâ Rajawali (‚≠ê2.4k) - Android OpenGL ES 2.0/3.0 Engine
  • üéâ raylib - a simple and easy-to-use library to enjoy videogames programming, hardware accelerated with OpenGL (1.1, 2.1, 3.3 or ES 2.0)
  • üéâ Ren'Py - An open-source visual novel engine using the Python language in simplified form. It supports Windows, Mac OS X, Linux, Android and iOS.
  • üéâ Rpgboss - A 2d rpg game engine and editor based on scala and libgdx. Ease of use, with no programming knowledge.
  • üéâ SDL - SDL is a cross-platform library designed to provide low level access to audio, keyboard, mouse, joystick, and graphics hardware via OpenGL and Direct3D.
  • üéâ SFML - Simple and Fast Multimedia Library.
  • üéâ Spring - A powerful free cross-platform RTS engine.
  • üéâ Stage.js - Lightweight and fast 2D HTML5 rendering and layout engine for cross-platform game development.
  • üéâ Starling - The GPU powered 2D Flash API
  • üí∏ Stencyl - a game creation platform that allows users to create 2D video games for computers, mobile devices, and the web.
  • üéâ Superpowers - HTML5 Collaborative 2D/3D Game Maker
  • üéâ TIC-80 - TIC-80 is a fantasy computer for making, playing and sharing tiny games.
  • üéâ Three.js - Javascript 3D Library.
  • üéâ Turbulenz - Turbulenz offers the ability to build, publish, iterate and monetise high-quality games that react like no others, with immersive 3D effects and real-time physics that open up a whole new world of unprecedented and extraordinary web content.
  • üéâ Twine - Downloadable or browser-based game development platform that allows users to create linked story paths. Not just text-based, Twine supports music, images, and sound effects. Very little coding knowledge required for basic text adventure games.
  • üí∏ Unity 3D - A development engine for the creation of 2D and 3D games and interactive content.
  • üéâ Urho3D - Cross-platform rendering and game engine.
  • üéâ ursina - A game engine powered by python and panda3d.
  • üéâ Vassal - Vassal is a game engine for building and playing online adaptations of board games and card games. Play live on the Internet or by email. Vassal runs on all platforms, and is free, open-source software.
  • üéâ voxel.js - voxel.js is a collection of projects that make it easier than ever to create 3D voxel games like Minecraft all in the browser.
  • üéâ Wave - Cross-platform engine written in C#.
  • üéâ Wolf RPG Editor English - open source editor for RPG Maker style gamesl
  • üéâ WhiteStorm.js (‚≠ê6.2k) - 3d javacript framework for building apps and games

AI / Voxel Editors

  • üéâ SimpleAI (‚≠ê178) - C++11 behaviour tree based library with a QT5 based remote debugger (and with optional LUA bindings) released under MIT.

Music and Audio Editors / Voxel Editors

  • üÜì Audiotool - Online music producer.
  • üÜì Bosca Ceoil - Online (and also desktop) music producer made by Terry Cavanagh. Simple, intuitive, has a distinctive retro-ish sound.

  • üéâ jfxr - A JavaScript port of the Bfxr sound effect generator.
  • üéâ LMMS - Cross-platform music production software.
  • üÜì MadTracker - a powerful and efficient approach to making music. Versatility and compatibility are guaranteed due to full VST‚Ñ¢, ASIO‚Ñ¢ and ReWire‚Ñ¢ support.
  • üéâ MilkyTracker (‚≠ê1.9k) - open source tracker for Mac/Linux/Windows platforms.
  • üéâ musagi - open source, fairly large and sophisticated music editor and synthesizer
  • üÜì Soundation - Online Professional music studio.
  • üÜì SunVox - a small, fast and powerful modular synthesizer with pattern-based sequencer (tracker).
